intro: Linaria bipartita, commonly known as the two-parted toadflax, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are showy, with two distinct lobes forming a bilabiate structure, and they range in color from yellow to orange. Linaria bipartita thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
